info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 4:49PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Tyler, northern Hardin and southeastern Jasper Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Votaw, or 7 miles north of Thicket, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Silsbee, Kountze, Fred, Wildwood, Warren, Town Bluff, Thicket, Buna, Caney Head, Votaw, Honey Island, Magnolia Springs, Mt. Union, Spurger, Village Mills, Ivanhoe and Hillister. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
